intro: Hieracium glabriceps, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy as well. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by pale yellow ray florets, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium glabriceps is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it can form dense colonies due to its rhizomatous growth habit.
